author: mrmitch
title: Cool plane and a Hang glider - 007 look out

author: Odeinoichus
title: Stop the Brickster
review:
Set #6735 Air Chase: This was the second Island Xtreme Stunts set I had prior to the Purge, due to spaceing issues I chose to let it go rather than keep it and I haven't regretted that decision yet. But this is still a really good set.

 

The pontoon plane is the primary model of this set and it has a lot of nice features. Aesthetically it looks very good, the special printed pieces of the plane look nice and the feature of the wings makes for a unique looking plane when landed. You can sweep them back on hinged plates in order to make the wings flush with the body, excellent for displays when you want to clear out some clutter.

 

The Brickster pilots the plane and as Mini-Figures go he's great. He was the only Mini-Figure I ever owned with that black tuque piece. And his face print looks criminal like.

 

The secondary part of this model is the small engine propelled glider. Built with unique colored orange and red plates and including a printed Island Xtreme Stunts logo, the glider was fun, but not a very practical vehicle to use to take on the Brickster's plane in a aerial battle. I believe the Mini-Figure's name is Snap Lockit, I have him with my other set too and he's ok, he looks like he's on some tropical island with yellow arms and legs.

 

Overall I'd say this is a good set from this Theme and if you want to own the Brickster without paying for the more expensive sets then this is a great set to pick up. The plane however does have one minor problem, the landing gear has a tendancy to fall off during extreme levels of play, sometimes it would even fall off when I just picked the plane up. But if you change it up a bit with some spare pieces I bet you could make it more solid and less prone to disassembling.
